calculator.title: Rating Calculator
calculator.players_same_sex: Players must be of different sexes
calculator.players_same: Selected players cannot be the same
calculator.info_description: This rating system is used to calculate rating point changes based on match results. The calculation depends on the rating difference between players and tournament coefficients.
calculator.lower_wins_formula: Winner gains points, loser loses the same amount.
exceptions_list: For matches between players without rating (Ri=0), the win and loss values HV and Hk are 0.
For matches between male and female players, the win and loss values HV and Hk are 0.

For matches between foreign and Estonian players, the Estonian player's HV and Hk are 0, while the foreign player's HV and Hk are calculated. The goal is to calculate Estonian rating as accurately as possible while providing approximate placement information for foreign players.

calculation_steps.step_1: 1.1. Find the absolute values of the sum of win and loss values from the tournament:
calculation_steps.coef_explanation: Coef is the tournament importance coefficient. Each player from the rating top 10 participating in the tournament class contributes one point, which are summed together. Maximum Coef value is therefore 10.
calculation_steps.coef_usage: Tournament importance coefficient is used in Estonian individual and team championships.
calculation_steps.weight_limit: If the player's initial weight (Ka) >30, then the weight value 30 is used in the formula.
calculation_steps.step_3: 1.3. To find the rating at the end of the tournament (Rl), the rating change (^R) is added to the initial rating (Ra)
calculation_steps.final_rating: Rating at the end of tournament (Rl) = Ra +^R
calculation_steps.rating_note: Positive ^R values increase and negative ^R values decrease the final rating.
calculation_steps.step_5: 1.5. To calculate weight (Kl) at the end of tournament, the weight change (^K) is added to the initial weight (Ka):

calculator.new_player_section: 2. New Player Rating and Weight Calculation

new_player_rules.intro: If a player without initial rating participates in a tournament, they are assigned an initial rating (Ra).
new_player_rules.rating_method: Initial rating is determined by finding the lowest rating of players who beat them and the highest rating of players they beat, then assigning the lower value.
new_player_rules.max_rating: Maximum initial rating is limited to 55. This limit does not apply to foreign players, and if a foreign player wins all games, +5 is added to their initial rating.
new_player_rules.initial_weight: Initial weight (Ka) value is set to zero.
new_player_rules.formula_intro: The following formula is used for rating calculation:
new_player_rules.final_calculations: New player rating and weight at the end of tournament:

weight_correction.high_weight_desc: Weights are corrected monthly on the 1st day before calculating new month results using the following formula, where Ka is weight before correction and Ku is weight after correction.
weight_correction.low_weight_desc: Weights are corrected every three months on the 1st day

ranking_compilation.intro: Ranking is compiled based on placement points (P), where Rl is rating points and Ku is corrected weights.

calculator.sum_calculation: Sum of win and loss values (absolute values)
calculator.coef_explanation: Coef is the tournament importance coefficient. Each player from the rating top 10 participating in the tournament class adds one point, which are summed together. Maximum Coef value is 10.
calculator.coef_usage: Tournament importance coefficient is used in Estonian individual and team championships.
calculator.weight_limit: If initial weight (Ka) > 30, then weight value 30 is used in the formula.
calculator.new_player_rules: New Player Rating and Weight Calculation
calculator.new_player_explanation: If a player without initial rating participates in a tournament, they are assigned an initial rating (Ra).
calculator.initial_rating_method: Initial rating is determined by finding the lowest rating of players who beat them and the highest rating of players they beat, then assigning the lower value.
calculator.max_initial_rating: Maximum initial rating is limited to 55. This limit does not apply to foreign players.
calculator.foreign_bonus: If a foreign player wins all games, +5 is added to their initial rating.
calculator.weight_correction_high: If Ka > 10: Corrected monthly on the 1st day before calculating new month results
calculator.weight_correction_low: If Ka < 11: Corrected every three months on the 1st day
calculator.placement_points: Ranking is compiled based on placement points (P), where Rl is rating points and Ku is corrected weights.
calculator.placement_calc: If Î”P > 0 then P = Rl - Î”P, If Î”P <= 0 then P = Rl
calculator.dropout_rule: Player drops out of ranking if Rl + (10 * Ku) < 100, except if they played in a rating tournament within 180 days.
calculator.points_retention: When dropping out, player's rating points (Rl) are not lost.
calculator.rounding_rule: Non-integer roundings follow standard rounding rules.
calculator.walkover_rule: Only the first walkover (W.O.) victory counts, others must be removed from input file.
calculator.games_rule: Input file may only contain games between two players. Matches/rounds with absent opponents ('bye') must be removed.
calculator.calculation_schedule: Rating is calculated on the 1st day of each month including all previous month competitions.
calculator.publication_rule: Rating is generated by ELTL authorized person and published within 10 days on ELTL website.
calculator.api_availability: Rating is available for third-party integration via web query in XML format.
calculator.tournament_fee: Tournament entry fee is set by ELTL board.
